text.section:
On request, the State Fire Marshal shall assist in fire prevention matters:
a chief of a fire company or department;
a legally designated fire marshal of a county or municipal corporation; or
a unit or agency of the State or a county or municipal corporation.

section.section:
The State Fire Marshal, assistant State fire marshals, and special assistant State fire marshals shall develop for each property owned or leased by the State:
fire safety procedures, including fire drills at least quarterly; and
emergency evacuation procedures.
Information about fire safety and emergency evacuation procedures shall be available to all State employees on request.

The State Fire Marshal shall require the State unit exercising control over the property owned or leased by the State to keep records of fire drills or other exercises that relate to fire safety and emergency evacuation procedures conducted in the property.

text.section: The State Fire Marshal may issue permits and licenses as required under this article.
On request, the State Fire Marshal may assist police and fire authorities to dispose of hazardous devices and substances.
